attributes.action: put pressure on UEFA to repeal Darren Fletcher's red card against Arsenal on 5th May 2009
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Darren Fletcher, a man who sums up all that is great about this country, was dealt the harshest of blows. The unjust red card he received robs him of his chance to play in the Champions League Final. If Gordon Brown doesn't turn his attention from this so-called 'financial crisis' or these phoney wars he's fighting to campaigning for justice for Darren, then it's a very sad day for this once great country. A very sad day indeed.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
